Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mj-AMP2 (MjAMP2, natural AMPs; knottin-type peptide; UCSS1a;  3S=S;  flowering seed plants)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: without disulfide bonds, it lost antifungal activity against F. culmorum.

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification: Three disulfide bonds.Activity: active against fungi A. brassicola (IC50 6 ug/ml), A. pisi (IC50 6 ug/ml), B. cinerea (IC50 2 ug/ml), C. beticola (IC50 2 ug/ml), C. lindemuthianum (IC50 1 ug/ml), F. culmorum (IC50 3 ug/ml), F. oxysporum (IC50 5-10 ug/ml), N. haematococca (IC50 0.5 ug/ml), P. betae (IC50 6 ug/ml), P. tritici-repentis (IC50 20 ug/ml), P. oryzae (IC50 0.5 ug/ml), R. solani (IC50 15 ug/ml), V. dahliae (IC50 0.5 ug/ml), V. inaequalis (IC50 1 ug/ml), bacteria B. megaterium (IC50 2 ug/ml), E.carotovora (IC50 >500 ug/ml), E.coli (IC50 >500 ug/ml), and S. lutea (IC50 50 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness:  pH-insensitive: activity retained after treatment at pH 2 or 11 for 60 min.Peptide stability: heat-stable: activity against F. culmorum was not influenced by heat treatment at 100oC for 10 min. Protease sability: resistant to proteinase K and trypsin, but not chymotrypsin or pronase E.Updated 7/2021; 11/2023; 11/2024
Literature Information.Author: Cammue BPA, de Bolle MFC, Terras FRG, Proost P, van Damme J, Rees SB, Vanderleyden J, Broekaert WF.1992
Literature Information.Title: Isolation and characterization of a novel class of plant antimicrobial peptides from Mirabilis jalapa L. seeds.
